settings.title: Genital Herpes Treatment
settings.subtitle: Genital Herpes is a sexually transmitted disease that can cause painful blisters and sores. Treat a herpes outbreak quickly with our range of medications.

settings.title: What are genital herpes?
settings.text: Genital herpes is an outbreak of the herpes simplex virus (HSV). There are two types of HSV that can cause genital herpes HSV-1 and HSV-2. The virus enters the body through a skin abrasion or mucous membrane (thin layer of tissue that lines the openings of the body) where they begin to multiply.

settings.title: How is genital herpes treated?
settings.text: Genital herpes medication can be used to reduce an outbreak and lessen painful symptoms but not cure the virus completely. Antiviral medications are taken at the first signs of an outbreak and will speed up the healing of the painful sores. There are also preventative medications available to reduce the likelihood of future outbreaks.

settings.title: of genital herpes cases in England during 2015 were found in heterosexual men and women
settings.text: According to NICE, genital herpes affected 30,658 people in England during 2015, these cases were predominantly in heterosexual people.

settings.title: of the world's population were living with HSV-2 in 2016
settings.text: According to WHO, an estimated 491.5 million people were living with the HSV-2 infection in 2016, equating to 13.2% of the world's population aged between 15-49 years.

settings.title: Buy Genital Herpes Treatment Online
settings.text: “It is characterised by sores or blisters in the genital area. There is no cure for genital herpes, but there are treatments that can help to control the symptoms.There are two types of treatments for genital herpes: antiviral medications and home remedies. Antiviral medications can help to reduce the severity and frequency of outbreaks, and they can also help to reduce the risk of transmitting the virus to others!”
settings.name: Dr Sameer Nakedar

settings.title: Express Delivery
settings.text: You will then receive your order the next working day using our express next-day courier service, dispensed from one of our verified GhPC partner pharmacies in the UK.

settings.title: What are the symptoms of genital herpes?
settings.text: Symptoms of genital herpes include blisters on the penis, vagina, scrotum or buttocks (near or around the anus). You can also get blisters on the mouth, lips or any area that came into contact with the area of infection. The blisters may itch or tingle before they appear and may turn into open sores that ooze fluid. The viral infection may also cause headaches, body aches and a fever.

settings.title: How serious is genital herpes?
settings.text: In most cases, genital herpes is known to be manageable without any long-term health consequences. It can be a more serious condition for those who gave HIV and for those who are pregnant.

settings.title: What are the stages of genital herpes?
settings.text: When genital herpes is contracted, it usually causes tingling or itching of the skin before any blisters appear. When blisters do appear, they can burst open to leave red and open sores around the affected areas.

settings.title: What is a genital herpes cream?
settings.text: A cream can be used to relieve the pain from genital herpes. Other medications, such as antiviral medicines can stop symptoms from getting worse.

settings.title: How long does it take to receive my order?
settings.text: All orders placed before 14:00 from Monday to Friday will be dispatched that day. The orders are sent using 24 Hour Tracked delivery provided by Royal Mail. Items will usually arrive the very next day after the order has been placed. We also provide tracking for your orders to check the status and location of your parcel.

settings.title: What is an online consultation?
settings.text: An online consultation checks if you are eligible to purchase the product. Some products only require an online consultation which approximately takes 1 minute to complete, enabling you to buy the product. Other products will also require a prescription; in this case, you will need to complete the online consultation, and then one of our partner pharmacy prescribers or doctors will review the online consultation questions and approve the order for delivery if you are eligible to purchase the item.

settings.title: How is the medication packaged?
settings.text: All our medication is packaged in plain confidential padded white or brown envelopes. This ensures that your orders are discreet, and the content of the orders will be for your eyes only.

settings.title: When will my order be delivered?
settings.text: If you have placed an order before 14:00 Monday to Friday, you will receive the order the next day.

settings.title: Can I return my order?
settings.text: For non-medicinal products, you are eligible to return the product within 14 days of receipt in the same packaging you received. For medicinal products, you are eligible to cancel the order only until it has been dispatched. From that point forward, you are no longer eligible to return the order.

settings.title: Can I cancel my order?
settings.text: You have the right to cancel your order for medication up to the point when your medication is dispatched.

settings.title: Is this medication suitable for me?
settings.text: Please get in touch with a doctor if you are unsure what medication is suitable for you. You can also complete our online consultation form to check your eligibility for the product.

settings.title: Can I order this if I am under 18 years old?
settings.text: No, we do not accept orders from individuals under 18. All orders must be placed by adults only.
